title: Here's my list of airlines to "like" on Facebook.
text:
10 North American Carriers You Should Be Following on Facebook "Like" these airlines Sign Up for our Free Newsletters Thanks, You're in! Health Tip of the Day Sign up There was an error. Please try again. Please select a newsletter. Please enter a valid email address. Did you mean ? Expert Videos 
Facebook has become an incredibly popular social media site that has become a must-use tool in reaching out and helping customers. Below is a list of North American-based carriers on Facebook and how they use the social media platform to interact with travelers. An Air Canada Boeing 787. Photo courtesy of Boeing 1. Air Canada 
The Canadian flag carrier not only offers updates on its own activities, but also things going on in the country. The page highlighted National Canadian Film Day, along with a memorial to its chairman emeritus, new service, photos from the airline and its fans, videos and contest winners. More » An Aeromexico Boeing 737 at Montréal-Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport. Photo courtesy of BriYYZ 2. Aeromexico 
The Facebook page for Mexico's flag carrier is in Spanish, but it can be easily translated via Google. Once that's done, the page includes events going on in the country, new service announcements, a spotlight on the Boeing 787 and promotional fare sales. More » Alaska Airlines at San Francisco International Airport. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 3. Alaska Airlines 
It's obvious that Seattle's hometown airline works on providing informational and inspirational posts. To announce new service, the carrier issues a post along with an infographic. It links to informational blog posts, announces sweepstakes winners and press releases. There's also a link to the carrier's Instagram feed . More » American Airlines Boeing 737-800. Photo courtesy of American Airlines 4. American Airlines 
This page is a great mix of trivia and company facts, vintage and modern photographs and posts on employee profiles. The carrier noted a major milestone in its merger with US Airways by releasing key numbers generated under the airline's single operating certificate. You can also tap into the carrier's Instagram page or click on a tab that takes you to American's home page to book a flight. More » 5. Delta Air Lines 
The Atlanta-based carrier uses its Facebook page to inform fans about flight and frequent-flyer deals, vintage and modern photos, bits on the carrier's operations, travel tips and a plug for enrollment in the Global Entry program (my post on that program is here ). More » Frontier Airlines Airbus A320 at Denver International Airport. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 6. Frontier Airlines 
The Denver-based ultra-low-cost airline uses is Facebook page to promote fare sales, post random aircraft photos, promote contests, show informational videos and show off events surrounding new routes. The page also offers a direct link to Frontier's booking section on its website. More » A Hawaiian Airlines Boeing 767-300. Photo courtesy of Dylan Ashe 7. Hawaiian Airlines 
The Honolulu-based carrier uses a mix of its own content and others to promote and inform its Facebook fans. Posts can offer captions to photos submitted by fans, list special vacation packages, promote its credit card, highlight beach photos and view videos. More » JetBlue tails at Boston Logan International Airport. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 8. JetBlue 
The New York-based airline's Facebook page has the same fun spirit as its Twitter account (read my post on airlines and their Twitter accounts here ). Among the posts are one commemorating opening day for baseball, a sale on True Blue frequent flyer points, an update of its #FlyItForward program, highlighting destinations served by JetBlue Getaways and fare sales. More » Southwest Airlines Boeing 737s at Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. Photo by Benet J. Wilson 9. Southwest Airlines 
The Dallas-based carrier offers a great mix of content including its affiliation as the official carrier of my Baltimore Orioles (along with the LA Dodgers and the San Diego Padres), a link to a blog post about how airport codes were created, stories about their customers and why they're flying, a list of fare sales and memorable #ThrowbackThursday photos. You can also link to the Southwest Air website to book a flight. More » United Airlines Boeing 747. Photo courtesy of United Airlines 10. United Airlines 
Chicago's hometown airline uses its Facebook page to highlight travel to 193 countries via 27 member airlines in the Star Alliance . The carrier also offers fare deals, profiles United Club lounges, provides travel updates and highlights its efforts in the communities it serves. United also has customer service agents on hand to help travelers who post comments or questions on the Facebook page. More » Related Articles
